confirmed_facts: Fire broke out on 26 November 2025 at approximately 14:50 local time in a highâ€‘rise apartment complex in Tai Po, Hong Kong.
At least 13 people died, including one firefighter, and about 10 people were injured.
The complex had 2,400 units and housed roughly 4,800 residents; 7 of the 8 blocks were engulfed in flames.
Bamboo scaffolding used for maintenance work was present and contributed to the fireâ€™s spread.
Hong Kong Fire Services classified the incident as a levelâ€‘5 fire and is conducting ongoing investigations.

timeline.event: Fire in a highâ€‘rise apartment complex in Tai Po, Hong Kong.
